content.text:
[cron:8b380d56-7314-4ba9-b4c4-ea11d3e5ca6f PR Review Patrol (High Frequency)] High-frequency PR patrol for bills-bot.

Repo: /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/

Do this each run:
1) List open PRs in BillChirico/bills-bot.
2) Skip bot-authored PRs by default (e.g., coderabbitai, dependabot[bot], renovate[bot]) unless Bill explicitly instructs otherwise.
3) For remaining PRs, count unresolved review threads.
4) If no unresolved threads on eligible PRs: respond exactly `NO_REPLY`.
5) If unresolved threads exist:
   - Spawn ONE sub-agent PER PR (parallel), never batch PRs together.
   - Use agentId `build`, model `anthropic/claude-opus-4-6`, thinking `high`.
   - Include full unresolved thread details (thread id, file path, line, issue summary).
   - Instruct spawned agents to read and follow CODING.md, fix all review comments (including nitpicks unless nonsensical/breaking/redundant), run tests/coverage, resolve threads.
   - Instruct spawned agents NOT to post PR summary comments unless Bill explicitly asks.
   - Have spawned agents report completion summary back to parent agent.
   - After spawning, send Bill a concise Discord DM status update:
     - channel: discord
     - target: user:191633014441115648
     - accountId: pip-build
     - include PR numbers and unresolved thread counts.
6) If any spawned run fails/stalls, note it in DM and respawn once.

Keep updates concise and action-oriented.
Current time: Wednesday, February 11th, 2026 ‚Äî 3:37 PM (America/New_York)

content.text:
# MEMORY.md ‚Äî Pip Build Long-Term Memory

## Key Facts

- **Owner:** Bill ‚Äî Founder & CEO of Volvox (<https://volvox.dev>)
- **Timezone:** EST (New Jersey)
- **Communication style:** Direct, snarky, witty humor, no fluff
- **Sibling agent:** Pip (personal assistant, agent ID: main)

## Active Projects

- **bills-bot** ‚Äî Discord bot (`/home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/`)
  - Repo: `https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot`
  - Stack: Node.js ESM, discord.js v14, pnpm, Biome, vitest, Winston
  - Railway DB: `postgresql://postgres:kxYyAlScRsIWqlvdDPhjguLVyriwPxfV@postgres.railway.internal:5432/railway` (internal only)
  - Board project: `bill-bot` (purple)

## Current PR Status

| PR  | Branch                                 | Status    | Notes                                                                                     |
| --- | -------------------------------------- | --------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| #14 | feat/db-config                         | ‚úÖ MERGED | 10 review rounds                                                                          |
| #15 | feat/deep-autocomplete-dynamic-welcome | ‚úÖ MERGED | 10 review rounds                                                                          |
| #16 | feat/repo-infrastructure               | ‚úÖ MERGED | All Round 2 review threads resolved (+1 extra bugbot thread) |
| #18 | feat/conversation-persistence          | üîÑ OPEN   | All 10 Round 1 review threads resolved; awaiting merge/new comments                       |

## Feature Pipeline (Bill-approved order)

1. ‚úÖ DB Config Persistence (PR #14 ‚Äî merged)
2. ‚úÖ Repo Infrastructure (PR #16 ‚Äî review in progress)
3. üîÑ Conversation Persistence (PR #18 ‚Äî review in progress)
4. ‚¨ú AI Conversation Threading (`task_20260211_FkSCUw`)
5. ‚¨ú User Memory via mem0 (`task_20260211_vglMFQ`)

## mem0 ‚Äî Shared Agent Memory (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

- **Access:** `mcporter call mem0.add_memory text="..."` / `mcporter call mem0.search_memory query="..."`
- Log after: every significant decision, completed task, config change, workflow discovery
- Search before acting when unsure about prior decisions

## Sub-Agent Workflow

### Rules (read `CODING.md` for full details)

- **Model:** `anthropic/claude-opus-4-6`, thinking: `"high"`
- **One sub-agent per PR** ‚Äî never batch. Parallel, not sequential.
- **Use `CODING.md`** ‚Äî all mandatory rules are there (codesession, Claude Code, git, board, tests)
- **Always fix nitpicks** ‚Äî unless nonsensical, would break things, or redundant

### Spawn Templates

**Board Task:**

```
sessions_spawn(
  agentId: "build",
  model: "anthropic/claude-opus-4-6",
  thinking: "high",
  task: "
    Read and follow CODING.md for all workflow rules.

    TASK: <title> (<taskId>)
    DESCRIPTION: <description>
    PRIORITY: <priority>
    PROJECT: <project>
    REPO: /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/

    SUBTASKS:
    <list all subtasks>

    DONE CRITERIA:
    <list all verificationSteps>

    DO THE WORK:
    <specific instructions>
  "
)
```

**PR Review:**

```
sessions_spawn(
  agentId: "build",
  model: "anthropic/claude-opus-4-6",
  thinking: "high",
  task: "
    Read and follow CODING.md for all workflow rules.

    TASK: Address PR #<N> review comments ‚Äî Round <R>
    PR: https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/pull/<N>
    Branch: <branch>
    Repo: /home/bill/.openclaw/workspace-build/bills-bot/

    UNRESOLVED THREADS:
    <list threads with IDs, file paths, line numbers, descriptions>

    Fix all issues. One commit per fix. Resolve each thread. Report summary back to parent agent (do not post PR summary comment unless Bill explicitly asks).
  "
)
```

## Veritas Kanban (the board)

- **API:** `http://localhost:3001` ¬∑ **CLI:** `vk <command>`
- **Projects:** `pip-build` (yellow), `bill-bot` (purple)
- **Sprint 1:** Feb 10‚Äì16 (ID: `sprint-1-foundation-E8UFrB`)
- **Sprint 2:** Feb 17‚Äì23 (ID: `sprint-2-YtRtwi`)
- **Restart:** `cd veritas-kanban/server && setsid node node_modules/tsx/dist/cli.mjs src/index.ts > /tmp/veritas-kanban.log 2>&1 &`
- **Quirks:** `vk done` needs `reviewComments` via API PATCH first ¬∑ `verificationSteps` use `POST /api/v1/tasks/:id/verification` (PATCH strips them)

## Critical Rules

- **‚ö†Ô∏è Send periodic sub-agent updates to Bill** ‚Äî proactively DM status. NON-NEGOTIABLE.
- **‚ö†Ô∏è Periodically monitor open PRs and fix review comments proactively** ‚Äî Bill explicitly requested this.
- **‚ö†Ô∏è Use masked markdown links for PRs** in Discord updates (e.g. `[#17](<https://github.com/...>)`).
- **‚ö†Ô∏è High-frequency PR patrol cron enabled** ‚Äî `PR Review Patrol (High Frequency)` every 10 min (job id: `8b380d56-7314-4ba9-b4c4-ea11d3e5ca6f`) to scan open PRs and spawn fix sub-agents when unresolved threads appear.
- **‚ö†Ô∏è Skip bot-authored PRs for auto-review** ‚Äî do not address comments on PRs opened by bots unless Bill explicitly says to (or the PR is one I opened).
- **‚ö†Ô∏è Board execution hygiene** ‚Äî when doing board tasks, keep subtasks and done criteria (verification steps) updated continuously; mark items checked/done as they are completed.
- **‚ö†Ô∏è End-of-task board gate** ‚Äî before marking a task done, ensure ALL done criteria are both actually completed in the work and explicitly checked off as completed in the board.
- **‚ö†Ô∏è PR vs Board comments rule** ‚Äî sub-agents should NOT post GitHub PR summary comments unless Bill explicitly asks; board comments are still expected and should remain verbose on board tasks.
- **‚ö†Ô∏è Merge conflict check** ‚Äî sub-agents must check for and fix merge conflicts with the target branch at the end of every task.
- **‚ö†Ô∏è Never edit `openclaw.json` directly** ‚Äî use `gateway config.patch` or `config.apply`
- **‚ö†Ô∏è `config.patch` array merge is SHALLOW** ‚Äî include ALL fields when patching agent list items
- **‚ö†Ô∏è `main` agent must be explicit in `agents.list`** when any agents are listed
- **‚ö†Ô∏è All models: Opus 4.6 primary, Codex fallback** ‚Äî no Flash anywhere
- **‚ö†Ô∏è Bill needs to set `DATABASE_URL` in Railway** for bills-bot DB features

## Infrastructure

See `TOOLS.md` for: MCP servers, endpoints, CLI tools, Tailscale IPs, codesession dashboard.

## Memory Rules

- Read `memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md` (today + yesterday) every session
- Update daily notes with what you worked on
- Push to mem0 after significant work
- Historical details live in `memory/` daily files ‚Äî MEMORY.md is for active state only

content.thinking:
**Clarifying Remote Origin**

Okay, I've got it. It seems the `git remote` for this setup is pointing to `BillChirico/pip.git`, which explains why the PR listing is off. I think I'm in the wrong directory, or `gh` is being context-sensitive and using the current location to list PRs from the wrong repo instead of the intended `bills-bot`.

**Reflecting on Current State**

My focus is shifting. I've been reflecting on the recent merge of PR #18. Now I'm updating my memory of the world, specifically my MEMORY.md file, to reflect the current state. I am considering if I need to take action based on its contents, in light of other considerations.


**Resolving conflicting actions**

I'm grappling with a conflict. Updating `MEMORY.md` is crucial, but it leads to a tool call, seemingly preventing a `NO_REPLY` response. However, after further reflection, the `NO_REPLY` constraint applies to the *PR state*, not my internal state. Editing the file still means responding to tool output, thus I'm re-evaluating when to issue a `NO_REPLY`. I will be updating `MEMORY.md` soon, so I need to output a tool call for edit, I've resolved that now, and am making the call.

It seems like the only change now is #18 going from open to merged. Also, I need to check the status of #19 and update the documentation accordingly.

I have verified the time of merge for PR #18, clarifying the relevant timestamps and timezones. My focus is finalizing documentation updates to MEMORY.md, and then responding appropriately based on tool call results. The system will handle the tool call, which, based on current instructions, will trigger my reply to the user. I'll adhere to the instructions on this and will respond with NO_REPLY after that.
